content:
I suggest you move back to oauth. Normal password, just do not work going forward. That is a choice of Google, not the Thunderbird folk. If you have two factor authentication, you might have to disable it while you add your account, but having it working you should be able to simply change to oauth and it will step you through the process of authenticating.

Right click the folder you are having issues with (except the italic ones) and in properties make sure you are set to include the folders when getting mail.

Check in your google settings here https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#settings/labels that the specific labels are enabled to show in IMAP. Not all are.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Matt, I appreciate your reply. I've tried to get OAuth2 for IMAP, and when I configure it, a separate window pops up to click 'Allow' for Thunderbird to have access. I click 'Allow' and it defaults to the localhost website.

Down at the bottom of the thunderbird window, it notes "Sending Login Information..." and will sit there for several hours. If I close the previously 'allow' window, the error 'Authentication failure while connecting to server imap.gmail.com.

I ran back through the configuration, and the hints at the bottom (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-gmail) without any change.

IMAP is enabled in my gmail by default. I disabled 2-factor on gmail.

Hope you look at this and eureka hits and you tell me which foot I should stand on :)

Cheers, --Mark
creator: mark.w.abbott

content: Just one additional update, not everything was checked as 'Show in IMAP", now it's all checked. So once we get oauth2 working, perhaps it will sort it self out.

content:
Non ho idea di che guida tu stia citando, ma quella voce dell'editor serve ad ordinare le cartelle non i messaggi.

Se guardi la lista dei messaggi, troverai in cima una riga con i nomi delle diverse colonne. Clicca una o due volte sulla colonna Data per cambiare l'ordinamento

Per quanto riguarda la guida ti allego uno screenshot di una di esse...la prima che mi è capitata Grazie
creator: apatri

content: Ci sono riuscito! In alto a destra, qualunque sia il tipo di visualizzazione dei messaggi( classica, estesa o verticale) c'è un pulsante "opzioni di visualizzazione dei messaggi" rappresentato da tre rettangolini con a fianco un mini cursore, cliccando li bisogna selezionare "ordina per data" e poi più sotto ci sono le voci "crescente" o decrescente", queste ultime due opzioni fanno si che i più recenti siano in basso o in alto. Saluti
creator: apatri

content:
Almost certainly Norton is the culprit, trying to intercept your secure connection to the server.

These are some generic suggestions to avoid problems with anti-virus software.

Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile

Don't let your anti-virus software scan incoming and outgoing messages.

Don't let your anti-virus software scan attachments.

Don't let your anti-virus software intercept your secure connection to the server.

Remove any add-ons your anti-virus software may have installed in Thunderbird.

Keep it working. http://kb.mozillazine.org/Keep_it_working_-_Thunderbird

And last but not least, backup your Thunderbird profile on a regular basis. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_backing-up-a-profile
creator: christ1

content: First, There is no ticket system for Thunderbird. You probably filed for support on the site for fee-paid services, which does not include Thunderbird. Second, I suggest you just reinstall thunderbird to stabilize where you are and then report issues. (Note: I do not understand the 32-bit x64 comment.)
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest doing a backup first of the profile. If using Windows, that would be at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird (not generally needed, but I like being safe.) Now download and install thunderbird. It will overlay any remaining remnants. I have no idea what may have deleted the prior version, possibly an antivirus program?
creator: davidsk

content: You're welcome, but if you are using an antivirus, I suggest seeing if it is the culprit. Some such software removes software without notifying the user, and that seems to be happening to you. A possibility is to see how to exclude some programs from being monitored. I wish you well.
